descriptionHtml:
[quote]This Overhaul completely changes your files. I looked everywhere to find the best
<br />mods and configurations that I were online for years, then I tried them all out in 
<br />different ways for the type of Skyrim I wanted to feel like. There's several bug 
<br />fixes and gameplay features were never fixed or added in the update. New animated 
<br />movements and abilities that make the game feel better but still vanilla. Better 
<br />visuals on everything without ruining performance. I know it's a lot to read but 
<br />its really simple. (Also already cracked and updated).
<br />
<br />As long as you have Skyrim correctly installed through steam or manually this 
<br />will work.
<br />
<br />So you'll need to delete everything from your /Documents/My Games/Skyrim
<br />path first. The same folder where tesv.exe and the Data folder are found in. 
<br />
<br />Once you've done that then copy all of my Skyrim files into the same folder.
<br />Afterwards you'll want to copy my skyrim.ini and skyrimprefs.ini into your
<br />/My Documents/My Games/Skyrim folder.
<br />
<br />This Overhaul is extremely compatible with itself. There are no problems or
<br />glitches between the mods I've placed that I can tell. You can always contact me if 
<br />there is an issue. 
<br />
<br />It also already has script extenders and other commonly required content when 
<br />adding mods that alter animation, gameplay, dialogue, sounds, whatever it may be.
<br />
<br />Everything is already set up for you, the only thing you might need to do is
<br />turn up/down the Texture Quality in the options menu or some of the other Qualities.
<br />It's the menu when you launch SkyrimLauncher.exe (NOT skse_loader.exe).
<br />
<br />Don't mess the distances in the View Distance tab unless your game is seriously
<br />running too slow. 
<br />
<br />Part of this Overhaul is that it puts in a lot different features to make the 
<br />game feel more real. While also adding a lot of cool things to make the game even
<br />more enjoyable without making it any easier. Take a look at the different features 
<br />from the mod list. I haven't had any trouble with compatibility.
<br />
<br />You'll have a lot of fun with this, so try it all out before you begin adding 
<br />anything to it.
<br /> 
<br />After that you can just start the game. The skse_loader.exe is the launcher you 
<br />need for Skyrim to launch now. The SkyrimLauncher.exe won't do anything other than 
<br />show you the options menu before the game starts.
<br />
<br />As always, give the game time when installing mods. Once you've finally gotten to a
<br />spot out of the intro, Wait for a Day or so in GameTime. It just helps everything
<br />settle and prevents crashing. 
<br />
<br />P.S. As a lovely gift, Don't go too crazy when you see Serana... New look, More Dialogue, New Ablities, and now Marriable. 
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />I will add a F.A.Q. once I get some questions
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />I don't know much about computers but I'll give you the basic specs I see.
<br />With my Computer specs this game runs more than perfect so don't worry if you have 
<br />less. And be happy if you have more, because you can turn up the quality even more.
<br />Motherboard: Asus ASUS M5A97 LE R2.0
<br />Processor: AMD FX-4350 Vishera Quad-Core 4.2 GHz
<br />Graphics Card: MSI GeForce GT 730 DirectX 12 N730K-1GD5LP/OC Core Clock 1006 MHz
<br />               1GB 64-Bit GDDR5
<br />Memory: G.SKILL Ripjaws X Series 16GB (2 x 8GB) Speed 1866
<br />[/quote]
author: Not My Mods Just My Mix
